==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|いろ|め|かね|k3=がね|r=y}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いろめがね|色|tr1=iro|t1=color|眼鏡|tr2=megane|t2=eyeglasses}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いろ めがね|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|いろ めがね}}

# [[colored]] [[glasses]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=いろめがね|metaphor}} a [[bias]], a [[preconception]] that [[color]]s one's [[perception]] of something

====Idioms====
* {{ja-r|'''色眼鏡'''で見る|'''いろめがね''' で みる|to see or look at something through colored glasses}}

====Usage notes====
This is similar to the English expression, {{m|en|wear rose-colored glasses|to see or look through rose-colored glasses}}. However, the English expression implies a [[positive]] bias, whereas the Japanese expression is neutral: the bias could be positive, or negative, or neither.
